ControlledList.ListName: Fire and Rescue Statistics - Incident Type List

Metadata.Creator: Fire and Rescue Statistics Division, HM Government
Metadata.Description: Fire and Rescue Statistics - Incident Recording System (IRS) Taxonomy/Hierarch File for Mobilisation Incident Types
Metadata.Subject.Project: Fire and Rescue Statistics - Incident Recording System
Metadata.Title: Fire and Rescue Statistics - Incident Recording System Taxonomy/Hierarch File for Mobilisation Incident Types

Item.Name: Incident Type
Item.ScopeNotes: Base item for all incident types

Item.Name: AFA
Item.ScopeNotes: Incidents involving automatic fire detection systems

Item.Name: Gas alarms
Item.ScopeNotes: Any incident where the RCC is called to a fixed installation gas alarm. Domestic, commercial, industrial

Item.Name: Smoke alarm
Item.ScopeNotes: Any report of a domestic smoke alarm operating. From a Member of the public or a monitoring station

Item.Name: Intruder alarm at FRS property
Item.ScopeNotes: Activiation of these alarms will be indicated through the RCC Systems. RCC will mobilise staff to investigate.

Item.Name: Fire alarm at FRS property
Item.ScopeNotes: Activiation of these alarms will be indicated through the RCC Systems. RCC will mobilise staff to investigate.

Item.Name: Explosion
Item.ScopeNotes: Report of an explosion at a domestic or industrial premises. Not including deliberate bomb attacks

Item.Name: Vehicle LPG fuelled
Item.ScopeNotes: Fires in vehicles fuelled by Liquid Petroleum Gas.

Item.Name: Abandoned call
Item.ScopeNotes: Any occasion where a call is made to an RCC where the call terminates prematurely and the information is incomplete

Item.Name: Aircraft large
Item.ScopeNotes: Large fixed wing commercial or private aircraft excluding military

Item.Name: Aircraft light
Item.ScopeNotes: Fixed wing recreational/crop spraying/small private aircraft. Including - microlite and helicopters

Item.Name: Aircraft military
Item.ScopeNotes: Incidents involving military aircraft. In flight or grounded

Item.Name: Barn
Item.ScopeNotes: Incidents involving agricultural storage premises other than silos. May contain livestock/straw/ hay/agrochems and farm machinery

Item.Name: Boat
Item.ScopeNotes: Fires involving recreational water borne craft. Barges, yachts, fishing boats

Item.Name: Building
Item.ScopeNotes: Any permanent or semi permanent built structure and attached/adjoining outbuildings

Item.Name: Building thatched
Item.ScopeNotes: Fire involving any building with a thatched roof

Item.Name: Caravan / camping
Item.ScopeNotes: Includes static caravans / tents, non permanent accommodation structures

Item.Name: Chimney
Item.ScopeNotes: Domestic property chimney fires. Not commercial/industrial or thatch properties

Item.Name: Chimney thatch
Item.ScopeNotes: Chimney fire in any property with a thatch roof

Item.Name: Cylinder acetylene
Item.ScopeNotes: Any incident specifically involving acetylene cylinder/s. Fire, Leak, Damaged

Item.Name: Cylinder other
Item.ScopeNotes: Fires/leakages of gas cylinders.

Item.Name: Derelict property
Item.ScopeNotes: Any property that is abandoned, officially uninhabited, awaiting demolition or in dangerous or unsafe condition

Item.Name: Electrical installations
Item.ScopeNotes: Fires involving non-domestic electrical installations and associated equipment

Item.Name: Fire
Item.ScopeNotes: Report of fire, where the nature of the fire cannot be specified by the caller. Too far away, unsure of location, in the distance

Item.Name: Fire in the open - large
Item.ScopeNotes: A fire in the open that covers a large area or involves large quantities of combustible materials.Scrapyards, large open areas, standing crops, woodland

Item.Name: Fire in the open - small
Item.ScopeNotes: A fire in the open that covers a small area or involves small quantities of combustible materials. Rubbish/bins, single tree, bushes, grass

Item.Name: Fire now out
Item.ScopeNotes: Any incident where a reported fire is now believed to be out.

Item.Name: Late fire call
Item.ScopeNotes: Incidents which involve a call to the Fire and Rescue Service where it is stated by the caller that the incident is believed to have concluded in excess of one hour prior to the time of call.

Item.Name: Persons
Item.ScopeNotes: Incidents involving a person or persons believed to be physically at risk from fire ie trapped by or in pysical contact with the fire. Such incidents may involve persons trapped within a building, vehicle enclosure etc.

Item.Name: Persons on fire
Item.ScopeNotes: Incidents involving an individual or individuals physically involved in fire including any part of the body and/or clothing worn by the victim/s.

Item.Name: Post box
Item.ScopeNotes: Fires involving the contents and or structure of freestanding post boxes, excluding those attached to or incorporated within a building.

Item.Name: Railway embankment
Item.ScopeNotes: Any fire in the open (large or small) occuring on property owned by the railways. Including lineside fires, embankments, sidings, verges and track

Item.Name: Railway train goods
Item.ScopeNotes: A railway incident involving fire in a goods/ mixed goods/tanker rolling stock

Item.Name: Railway train passenger
Item.ScopeNotes: A railway incident involving a fire in a passenger train

Item.Name: Road furniture
Item.ScopeNotes: Fires involving all types of roadside furniture.

Item.Name: Ship
Item.ScopeNotes: Any fire on a seagoing vessel, in any compartment or part of the ship including any cargo

Item.Name: Smoke in the open
Item.ScopeNotes: Report of smoke of from a source that is not immediately identifiable

Item.Name: Vehicle large
Item.ScopeNotes: Any large road vehicle involved in fire

Item.Name: Vehicle small
Item.ScopeNotes: Fire involving any small vehicle. Car, small van, motorcycle, light plant vehicle,

Item.Name: Below ground fire
Item.ScopeNotes: A subterranean fire not readily accessible from ground level. Cable ductings,mines,underground transport systems.

Item.Name: Advice given
Item.ScopeNotes: Any incident where no F&RS attendance is required. But appropriate advice is given to the caller. Burst pipe, other services

Item.Name: Aircraft landing
Item.ScopeNotes: Standing by at non emergency landing situation.

Item.Name: Assist other agency
Item.ScopeNotes: Requests to assist other agencies with non-emergency events. Lifting heavy casualties, swilling away, body recovery

Item.Name: Boat stability
Item.ScopeNotes: Incidents where boats require assistance in danger of sinking

Item.Name: Co responder
Item.ScopeNotes: The mobilisation of trained fire crews to provide emergency medical assistance to members of the public,

Item.Name: Dangerous structure
Item.ScopeNotes: Incident involving any structure which presents a hazard due to its unsafe condition. Collapse, falling debris, damage to property

Item.Name: Fire safety issue
Item.ScopeNotes: The provision of immediate advice or referral of the issue to a specialist fire safety officer or department. Including Fire Safety complaints

Item.Name: Flooding
Item.ScopeNotes: Incidents involving all types of flooding including: All building types, flash flooding, flooding in open ground, farm land, highways, vehicles etc.

Item.Name: Inform other agency
Item.ScopeNotes: Forwarding information received at the RCC to appropriate external agencies

Item.Name: Persons collapsed
Item.ScopeNotes: Incidents involving a person or persons who have become incapacitated and are unable to walk or move unaided including persons that are either concious or unconcious.

Item.Name: Persons locked out
Item.ScopeNotes: Incidents involving persons who are unable to gain unassisted entry into a room, building, vehicle or other such enclosure where urgent entry is essential to ensure the health,safety and welfare of themselves and/or others.

Item.Name: RTC
Item.ScopeNotes: Incidents involving road traffic collisions' where no persons are involved. F&RS attends for safety purposes only

Item.Name: Supply water
Item.ScopeNotes: Requests to assist with the supply of bulk water

Item.Name: Swill away
Item.ScopeNotes: Any request from recognised authorities to assist with the removal by washing away low or non hazard substances from a public place

Item.Name: Gas involved
Item.ScopeNotes: Incidents involving all types of gas leak from mains or fixed installations excludingcylinder supplies. Such incidents would include domestic and commercial Gas, Carbon Monoxide, Ammonia, Methane etc

Item.Name: Haz mat minor
Item.ScopeNotes: Incidents involving low hazard substances with little or no potential to escalate and with only the potential to cause minimal risk to life or property. eg leaks from domestic fridges,unknown substances in garden sheds etc.

Item.Name: Oil pollution
Item.ScopeNotes: Incidents involving the spillage, leakage or contamination of oil products including mineral and synthetic oils. Such incidents may involve the requirement for decontamination, containment or absorbtion.

Item.Name: Pipeline
Item.ScopeNotes: Incidents involving above ground or subteranean pipelines including fractures,leaks,explosions.

Item.Name: Radiation involved
Item.ScopeNotes: Any incident involving the accidental or deliberate release of a radioactive source or substance includes Incidents involving Irradiated Nuclear Fuel ie Plutonioum or high level Radioactive Waste (not CCBRN)

Item.Name: Unidentified smell
Item.ScopeNotes: Any report of an unidentified smell causing concern or having an adverse effect on people in an area

Item.Name: Vehicle leaking fuel
Item.ScopeNotes: Any report of a fuel spillage originating from a vehicle, not RTC.

Item.Name: Haz mat major
Item.ScopeNotes: Incidents involving confirmed high hazard substances which have the potential to escalate and/or cause significant risk to life or property. Such substances may include chemical, Biological, Radiological or Nuclear. Not including CCBRN.

Item.Name: Aircraft accident large
Item.ScopeNotes: Large fixed wing commercial or private aircraft excluding military

Item.Name: Aircraft accident light
Item.ScopeNotes: Fixed wing recreational/crop spraying/small private aircraft. Including - microlights and helicopters

Item.Name: Aircraft in distress
Item.ScopeNotes: Calls originating from airport authorities, indicating aircraft reporting in flight problems

Item.Name: Animal rescue large
Item.ScopeNotes: Animals suffering physical entrapment, beyond the lifting capabilities of one person or requiring specialist equipment

Item.Name: Animal rescue small
Item.ScopeNotes: Animals suffering physical entrapment, within the lifting capabilities of one person not requiring specialist equipment

Item.Name: Boat rescue
Item.ScopeNotes: Assisting people in distress on boats. Evacuation

Item.Name: Building collapse
Item.ScopeNotes: Collapse of any permanent or semi permanent built structure and attached/adjoining outbuildings

Item.Name: Evacuation of persons
Item.ScopeNotes: Incident involving assisting with the evacuation of people from a place of imminent danger to a place of safety.

Item.Name: Lift persons shut in
Item.ScopeNotes: Incidents involving persons stuck within the confines of a lift car due to mechanical failure or physical restriction ie persons are unable to make their own way out unassisted.

Item.Name: Persons locked in
Item.ScopeNotes: Incidents involving persons secured within the confines of a room, building, vehicle or other such enclosure and are unable to make their own way out unassisted and where urgent exit is essential to ensure the health,safety and welfare of themselves and/o

Item.Name: Persons trapped
Item.ScopeNotes: Incidents involving a person or persons physically trapped by objects, structures, machinery or their physical location, such as a cliff face etc, and are unable to release themselves to a place of safety without urgent assistance.

Item.Name: Railway accident
Item.ScopeNotes: The rescue and evacuation assitance of people involved in rail accidents, breakdowns, collisions, derailments, suicides.

Item.Name: Rescue from confined space
Item.ScopeNotes: Assisting at or facilitating rescue of persons from confined spaces and or underground

Item.Name: Rescue from entrapment
Item.ScopeNotes: The release of persons from which they are physically trapped and unable to free themselves.

Item.Name: Rescue from height
Item.ScopeNotes: The release of persons physically trapped and/or unable to free themselves at height. Includes any person at any location in an elevated position

Item.Name: Rescue from mud
Item.ScopeNotes: Release of persons physically trapped and unable to free themselves from mud, earth, quicksand, slurry

Item.Name: Rescue from water
Item.ScopeNotes: The rescue of persons from or adjacent to water, both static and flowing or ice.

Item.Name: RTC persons trapped (large vehicles)
Item.ScopeNotes: Incidents involving the rescue of persons from road traffic collisions' where large or heavy goods vehicles are involved.

Item.Name: RTC persons trapped (small vehicles)
Item.ScopeNotes: Incidents involving the rescue of persons from road traffic collisions' not involving large or heavy goods vehicles

Item.Name: Ship sinking
Item.ScopeNotes: Any assistance or professional advice that can be given to vessels in distress.

Item.Name: Suicide attempt
Item.ScopeNotes: Standing by and assisting other agencies as required at suicide threat incidents.

Item.Name: UKFRSSART
Item.ScopeNotes: Incident in which the UK FRS Search and Rescue Team is requested to be sent abroad

Item.Name: Bomb confirmed
Item.ScopeNotes: Incidents where the threat of an explosive device has been confirmed

Item.Name: Bomb suspected
Item.ScopeNotes: Responding as requested to incidents where there is a credible threat of terrorist explosive devices

Item.Name: Civil disturbance
Item.ScopeNotes: Incidents where there is large scale civil unrest.

Item.Name: Call challenged pp - public pay phone
Item.ScopeNotes: Any occasion where a report of an incident is received by a RCC which is believed to have been made with malicious intent or with intent to cause a nuisance and where it is considered that no legitimate incident exists.From a public Pay phone.

Item.Name: Call challenged mp - mobile phone
Item.ScopeNotes: Any occasion where a report of an incident is received by a RCC which is believed to have been made with malicious intent or with intent to cause a nuisance and where it is considered that no legitimate incident exists.From a mobile.

Item.Name: Call challenged ps - public subscriber line
Item.ScopeNotes: Any occasion where a report of an incident is received by a RCC which is believed to have been made with malicious intent or with intent to cause a nuisance and where it is considered that no legitimate incident exists.From a mobile.

Item.Name: Not Known
Item.ScopeNotes: A command and control system can't identify a code as it only possesses a Description.
